|Title=Knowing the definition of pulmonary hypertension (PH) in adults
|Description=None
|Topic=Definition
|Contributors=
|Order=3}}
Pulmonary hypertension (PH) is defined as mean pulmonary arterial pressure >20 mmHg and resistance >3 UW measured during right heart catheterisation. When it is secondary to CKD, it is classified in group 3 of PH. It is suspected on cardiac ultrasound by assessment of systolic blood pressure (SBP >35mmHg). Confirmation by right heart catheterisation is rarely indicated in cases of documented CKD.

question.question: What is the correct definition of pulmonary hypertension (PH) in adults?
question.option_a: Mean pulmonary arterial pressure >15 mmHg and resistance >2 WU
question.option_b: Mean pulmonary arterial pressure >20 mmHg and resistance >3 WU measured during right heart catheterisation
question.option_c: Mean pulmonary arterial pressure >25 mmHg and resistance >3 WU measured during echocardiogram
question.option_d: Mean pulmonary arterial pressure >20 mmHg and resistance <3 WU measured during right heart catheterisation
